title: BaseR
text:
Assign BP values for pre- and post-treatment to vectors


bpPre <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)
bpPost <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)


Assign names to the vector elements


bpNames <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep= "_")
names(bpPre) <- bpNames
names(bpPost) <- bpNames


Assign BP change to new vector (value > 0 indicates decrease)


bpChange <- bpPre - bpPost


Average decrease for all patients


mean(bpChange)

[1] 5.65



Patients with a decrease in BP


which(bpChange > 0)

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         2          4          6          7          8          9         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        13         14         15         16         17         18         19 
Subject_20 
        20 



Subset of BP changes that are greater than 0


bpChange[bpChange > 0]

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         6          4         10          9          3          8         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
         7         21         12          8         19         18          7 
Subject_20 
        17 



Average decrease in BP for patients with positive change


mean(bpChange[bpChange > 0])

[1] 10.6






create data frame from above data


bp_df = data.frame(patient = 1:20, pre_bp = bpPre, post_bp = bpPost,
                   diff_bp = bpChange)


Rows where diff_bp < 0


bp_df[bp_df$diff_bp < 0,]

           patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
Subject_1        1    120     127      -7
Subject_3        3    125     135     -10
Subject_11      11    127     132      -5
Subject_12      12    122     146     -24



Add new column denoting whether post BP is less than 120 or not


bp_df$less120 <- bp_df$post_bp < 120


Print data frame


knitr::kable(bp_df)





patient
pre_bp
post_bp
diff_bp
less120

Create new data frame with placebo patients


# vectors for data columns
placeboPre <- c(138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134, 114, 121, 131, 130)
placeboPost <- c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 135, 139, 120, 124)
placeboDiff <- placeboPre - placeboPost 
placebo120 <- placeboPost < 120

# assign names (using subset of bpNames from above)
names(placeboPre) <- bpNames[1:10]
names(placeboPost) <- bpNames[1:10]

# create data frame
placebo_df <- data.frame(patient = 1:10, pre_bp = placeboPre, 
                         post_bp = placeboPost, diff_bp = placeboDiff,
                         less120 = placebo120)


Create a list for treatment and placebo data


bp_list <- list(treatment = bp_df, placebo = placebo_df)


Access the first list element


# syntax 1
bp_list[1]

$treatment
           patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp less120
Subject_1        1    120     127      -7   FALSE
Subject_2        2    151     145       6   FALSE
Subject_3        3    125     135     -10   FALSE
Subject_4        4    126     122       4   FALSE
Subject_5        5    115     115       0    TRUE
Subject_6        6    132     122      10   FALSE
Subject_7        7    132     123       9   FALSE
Subject_8        8    129     126       3   FALSE
Subject_9        9    134     126       8   FALSE
Subject_10      10    139     129      10   FALSE
Subject_11      11    127     132      -5   FALSE
Subject_12      12    122     146     -24   FALSE
Subject_13      13    127     120       7   FALSE
Subject_14      14    135     114      21    TRUE
Subject_15      15    133     121      12   FALSE
Subject_16      16    128     120       8   FALSE
Subject_17      17    147     128      19   FALSE
Subject_18      18    138     120      18   FALSE
Subject_19      19    140     133       7   FALSE
Subject_20      20    132     115      17    TRUE

# syntax 2
bp_list["treatment"]

$treatment
           patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp less120
Subject_1        1    120     127      -7   FALSE
Subject_2        2    151     145       6   FALSE
Subject_3        3    125     135     -10   FALSE

Subject_9        9    134     126       8   FALSE

Subject_12      12    122     146     -24   FALSE

Subject_14      14    135     114      21    TRUE
Subject_15      15    133     121      12   FALSE
Subject_16      16    128     120       8   FALSE
Subject_17      17    147     128      19   FALSE
Subject_18      18    138     120      18   FALSE
Subject_19      19    140     133       7   FALSE
Subject_20      20    132     115      17    TRUE

# syntax 3
bp_list$treatment

           patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp less120
Subject_1        1    120     127      -7   FALSE
Subject_2        2    151     145       6   FALSE
Subject_3        3    125     135     -10   FALSE

Subject_5        5    115     115       0    TRUE

Access just the pre_bp column of the placebo data frame


bp_list[["placebo"]]$pre_bp

 [1] 138 135 147 117 152 134 114 121 131 130

title: BaseR
text:
Assign BP values for pre- and post-treatment to vectors


bpPre <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)
bpPost <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)


Assign names to the vector elements


bpNames <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep= "_")
names(bpPre) <- bpNames
names(bpPost) <- bpNames


Assign BP change to new vector (value > 0 indicates decrease)


bpChange <- bpPre - bpPost


Average decrease for all patients


mean(bpChange)

[1] 5.65



Patients with a decrease in BP


which(bpChange > 0)

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         2          4          6          7          8          9         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        13         14         15         16         17         18         19 
Subject_20 
        20 



Subset of BP changes that are greater than 0


bpChange[bpChange > 0]

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         6          4         10          9          3          8         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
         7         21         12          8         19         18          7 
Subject_20 
        17 



Average decrease in BP for patients with positive change


mean(bpChange[bpChange > 0])

[1] 10.6

title: BaseR
text:
Create new data frame with placebo patients


# vectors for data columns
placeboPre <- c(138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134, 114, 121, 131, 130)
placeboPost <- c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 135, 139, 120, 124)
placeboDiff <- placeboPre - placeboPost 
placebo120 <- placeboPost < 120

# assign names (using subset of bpNames from above)
names(placeboPre) <- bpNames[1:10]
names(placeboPost) <- bpNames[1:10]

# create data frame
placebo_df <- data.frame(patient = 1:10, pre_bp = placeboPre, 
                         post_bp = placeboPost, diff_bp = placeboDiff,
                         less120 = placebo120)


Create a list for treatment and placebo data


bp_list <- list(treatment = bp_df, placebo = placebo_df)


Access the first list element


# syntax 1
bp_list[1]

$treatment
           patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp less120
